page.title: 12SUTTON FIRST SCHOOL
page.content: There are records of a village school in Sutton since 1873, but the present school is housed in a modern building built 10 years ago. It takes in children at the age of 4 or 5 and they leave when they are 8. In July 1985 the number of pupils was 65, but this number varies considerably from year to year as families move in and out of the village. The teaching staff consists of a Head Teacher and 3 other teachers. In addition to Sutton children, the school also takes children from the village of Ingham. The school is an integral part of village life and, in addition to parents, many other villagers attend concerts and entertainments given by the children during the year. The school has a kitchen to provide a mid-day meal for the children who want one.
